summary: Amazon has witnessed a nearly threefold rise in valuation over the last few years . Amazon continues to invest in various areas of AI that can help accelerate revenue growth and profit margin expansion . While Amazon stock has recovered from a notable dip last month, it still looks like an attractive buy for long-term investors .  Hedge fund manager Bill Ackman initiated a stake in Amazon through his investment firm, Pershing Square Capital Management . The most obvious area of Amazon's ecosystem that has benefited from the AI boom so far is the company's cloud computing segment, Amazon Web Services .  Amazon is testing various forms of AI robotics in its fulfillment centers . Amazon is also developing its own custom chipsets -- dubbedTrainiumand Inferentia . Amazon's stock has declined by roughly 1% on the year .  Pershing Square's Amazon position was not included in the fund's 13F filing for the first quarter . Amazon's valuation has risen considerably more than those of bothMicrosoftandAlphabet . This is significant because both companies compete fiercely with Amazon in the cloud computing market .  Amazon has a strong foundation to continueaccelerating revenue and profit growth for the long run . Nvidia has been the best Magnificent Seven investment throughout the AI revolution thus far . Amazon's current trajectory supports the idea that the company could see a more than twofold rise in market cap .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $653,702! The Motley Fool’s total average return is 988% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 .  Sister to Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . Adam Spatacco has a position in Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia .

I have a virtual private server with several services running on it . It has replacements for Google Drive, Whatsapp, and Github (or Gitlab) Getting a sufficiently good internet connection that would allow me to use a real (on-premise) machine instead of a virtual one is very difficult where I live .  An increasing number of companies think they will be the ones to create 'incredible artificial intelligence' The more data they can collect, the better, seems to be the prevailing modus operandi . Once they're done collecting, throw everything into the blender and hope for the best . This is where CoreWeave(CRWV)comes in .  CoreWeave released its earnings report for Q1 2025 on May 14th . Revenue of $981.6 million, a 420% increase year-over-year . Adjusted EBITDA of $606.1 million was a 480% increase YoY . Guidance for the full year 2025 was: Revenue from $4.9 billion to $5.1 billion .  In Q1, CoreWeave expanded its deal with OpenAI bringing the total contract value to $15.9 billion . Analysts forecasted $21 billion of negative free cash flow for the company through calendar year 2027 .  Analysts cut their rating on the stock after CoreWeave's recent rally, arguing there's less room for shares to head higher . Sills and Liu noted that the stock is trading at twenty-five times its calendar year 2027 EBIT estimate . "We believe much of the near-term upside has been priced in," concluded analysts . In collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and NVIDIA, whitepaper introduces framework for telco-verticalized AI agents, emphasizing ontology, reasoning, simulation, trust and brand engineering . While telecom sector has embraced generative AI at pace, many deployments fall short of true operational integration .  These agents deliver network-aware, context-sensitive responses and executing intelligent decision-making rooted in domain expertise . Ontology is the Backbone of Telco Intelligence for AI agents to operate effectively in the telecommunications industry .  well-defined telco ontology provides AI agents with a contextual understanding of service plans, technical specifications, billing structures, and customer interactions . This structured framework ensures AI agents deliver accurate, relevant, and uniform responses, while allowing for seamless collaboration across systems and sub-agents .  For operators, a digital twin is a real-time virtual replica of their physical network . Data, analytics, and AI/ML form the core foundation of any effective digital twin . Simulation plays a critical role by offering a safe and scalable environment to train and test AI agents . It allows agentic AI to learn complex decision-making, anticipate outcomes, adapt strategies, and operate autonomously .  As AI agents become the first touchpoint between companies and their customers, how they sound, look, and respond carries real brand weight . 80% of consumers said they trust AI agents to resolve service issues . 60% believe AI can positively shape their perception of a brand-when done right .  Enterprise-grade agents must also possess robust non-functional capabilities . These horizontal capabilities encompass crucial aspects like trust and security, which are fundamental to the reliability and effectiveness of GenAI solutions in the telecommunications sector .  Amdocs has partnered with AWS to build enterprise-grade, cloud-native AI solutions . The collaboration has focused on harnessing generative AI to transform customer experiences, network automation and deliver operational efficiencies .  Amdocs, AWS, and NVIDIA have demonstrated several collaborations that show the real-world impact of GenAI in telecom . Amdocs will be demonstrating its joint AI agent solutions with NVIDIA at TM Forum's Digital Transformation World Ignitein Copenhagen, June 17-19, 2025 .  Amdocs helps those who build the future to make it amazing with its portfolio of software products and services . Amdocs had revenue of $5.00 billion in fiscal 2024 . Oppenheimer analysts estimate the total addressable global sovereign AI market could be $1.5 trillion, including $120 billion in Europe . Shares of Nvidia have added roughly a third of their value since the end of April .  Huang’s stop in Germany followed a keynote address at the VivaTech conference in Paris . Huang also stopped in the United Kingdom for London Tech Week . Shares of Nvidia rose about 2% Monday to near $145, closing in on its record close of $149.41 .

Investor sentiment and risk appetite rebounded sharply on Monday as fears around the Israel-Iran conflict subsided . In my column today I look at why the dollar's status as a safe-haven asset in times of heightened geopolitical uncertainty may be fading . More on that below, but first, a roundup of the main market moves .  Oil slides as much as 4% at one stage on Monday but Brent futures settle only 1.35% lower at $73.23/bbl . Wall Street rebounds strongly, with the S&P 500 back above 6000 points and the Nasdaq gaining 1.4% . Nvidia shares rise 2% to the highest since January 24,within sight of the record peak of $153.13 .  Wall Street and world stocks back to within sight of recent highs . Iran has called for U.S. President Donald Trump to get Israel to halt its attacks, but both countries continue to fire missiles at each other . Optimism that a truce will be reached appears to be stronger in equity markets .  Markets have been resilient to Middle East conflicts in recent years, with selloffs proving to be shallow and short-lived . Unless there is a real adverse oil price shock, it will probably be a similar story this time around . But spiking inflation would be problematic for central banks .  The dollar's response to Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities and military commanders was pretty feeble . The dollar index, a measure of the currency's value against a basket, was a weak . The Bank of Japan will deliver its policy decision on Tuesday .  Dollar fared better than U.S. stocks or Treasuries, which both fell sharply on Friday . But with oil surging over 7% and gold up a solid 1.5%, a strong 'flight to quality' flow would have lifted the dollar more than a quarter of one percent .  The dollar has historically been one of the best hedges against short-term volatility sparked by geopolitical risk . The dollar accounts for almost 60% of the world's $12 trillion FX reserves, with its nearest rival, the euro, accounting for around 60% .  Almost two-thirds of global debt is denominated in dollars, and nearly 90% of all FX transactions around the world have the greenback on one side of the trade . However, the dollar's downside 'structural' risks are growing, analysts at Westpac noted on Sunday .  If the Israel-Iran conflict continues to escalate, that dollar smile could get rather lopsided . The idea was first outlined over 20 years ago by then currency analyst Stephen Jen . South Korea trade (May) and Germany ZEW investor sentiment survey (June)
